alert.note: Alert for Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 8:38PM CDT until April 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... Mississippi River At Natchez affecting Wilkinson, Concordia and Adams Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY, APRIL 29... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Natchez. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Friday, April 29. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Carthage Point Road becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 45.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday afternoon and crest at 49.0 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Mississippi River Natchez 48.0 45.8 Wed 7 pm CDT 46.6 47.4 48.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 845 AM CDT.
